lines: <meta name="description" content="A brief description">
<meta name="keywords" content="html, cheatsheet">
<p>This is a paragraph of text.</p>
<abbr title="HyperText Markup Language">HTML</abbr>
<img src="image.jpg" alt="Description of image">
<img src="placeholder.png" alt="Placeholder" width="100" height="100">
<input type="text" id="name" name="name" required>
<input type="number" min="0" max="100">
<input type="checkbox" id="agree"><label for="agree">Agree</label>
<input type="radio" name="gender" value="male"> Male
<textarea rows="5" cols="30" placeholder="Your message"></textarea>
Your browser does not support the audio element.
<video width="320" height="240" controls>
Your browser does not support the video tag.
<iframe src="https://example.com" width="600" height="400" allowfullscreen></iframe>
<!-- This is an HTML comment -->
<p title="Tooltip text">Hover over me</p>
<input type="text" onkeydown="console.log('Key Down')">
<input type="text" onkeyup="console.log('Key Up')">
<div role="button" tabindex="0">Custom Button</div>
<circle cx="50" cy="50" r="40" stroke="green" stroke-width="4" fill="yellow" />
<canvas id="myCanvas" width="200" height="100" style="border:1px solid #000;"></canvas>
// JavaScript to draw on canvas
ctx.fillRect(0, 0, 150, 75);
const shadow = this.attachShadow({ mode: 'open' });
shadow.innerHTML = `<p>Hello from custom element!</p>`;

content-blocks.content: Avoid using these tags as they are either deprecated or obsolete in HTML5. Use CSS for styling instead.

lines: <strike>Use <del> or CSS text-decoration</strike>
<frame>, <frameset>, <noframes> (Use <iframe> or CSS layout)
<meta name="description" content="A concise summary of the page content.">
<meta name="keywords" content="html, css, javascript, web development">
<meta name="author" content="Your Name">
<meta name="robots" content="index, follow">
<meta property="og:title" content="Your Page Title">
<meta property="og:description" content="A short description for social media.">
<meta name="twitter:title" content="Your Page Title">
<meta name="twitter:description" content="A short description for Twitter.">
<link rel="icon" href="/favicon-32x32.png" type="image/png" sizes="32x32">
<link rel="apple-touch-icon" href="/apple-touch-icon.png"> // For Apple devices
// Works identically to localStorage, but data is cleared when session ends

content.content: Web Storage is primarily a JavaScript API, but its purpose is to store data for HTML pages. Data is stored as strings.

lines: <div draggable="true" ondragstart="event.dataTransfer.setData('text/plain', this.id)" id="drag1">Drag Me</div>

<div ondragover="event.preventDefault()" ondrop="event.preventDefault(); var data = event.dataTransfer.getData('text'); event.target.appendChild(document.getElementById(data));" style="width:100px;height:100px;border:1px solid black;">Drop Here</div>
<img itemprop="image" src="john-doe.jpg" alt="John Doe">
<meta itemprop="name" content="The Great Book">
<meta itemprop="ratingValue" content="5">5 stars</div>
<p>Reviewed by <span itemprop="author" itemscope itemtype="http://schema.org/Person">
<p itemprop="reviewBody">This book was absolutely fantastic!</p>
